body:
I was trying to install `gcc` and see following : 

```bash
○ → spack purge -a
○ → spack install -v gcc@4.9.4 %gcc@4.4.7        #same for 4.9.3
....
==> Trying to fetch from http://ftp.gnu.org/gnu/gcc/gcc-4.9.4/gcc-4.9.4.tar.bz2
######################################################################## 100.0%
==> Staging archive: /some-gpfs-path/spack/var/spack/stage/gcc-4.9.4-ybvygharx7lyngmbsgb224cqm65jinib/gcc-4.9.4.tar.bz2
==> Created stage in /some-gpfs-path/spack/var/spack/stage/gcc-4.9.4-ybvygharx7lyngmbsgb224cqm65jinib
Reversed (or previously applied) patch detected!  Assume -R? [n]
```

I haven't looked at which `patches` but wondering if those are backported or something else.
title: spack patches for gcc installation (version 4.9.x)
